   19: -module(upgrade_SUITE).
   20: 
   21: -compile(export_all).
   22: 
   23: -compile(r22).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -define(upgr_sname,otp_upgrade).
   29: 
   30: %% Applications that are excluded from this test because they cannot
   31: %% just be started in a new node with out specific configuration.
   32: -define(start_exclude,
   33: 	[cosEvent,cosEventDomain,cosFileTransfer,cosNotification,
   34: 	 cosProperty,cosTime,cosTransactions,erts,ic,netconf,orber,
   35: 	 safe,wx,observer,et,debugger,dialyzer]).
   36: 
   37: %% Applications that are excluded from this test because their appup
   38: %% file don't support the upgrade.
   39: %% In specific:
   40: %% - erl_interface, jinterface support no upgrade
   41: -define(appup_exclude, [erl_interface,jinterface]).
   42: 
   43: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   44:     %% Check that a real release is running, not e.g. cerl
   45:     ok = application:ensure_started(sasl),
   46:     case release_handler:which_releases() of
   47: 	[{_,_,[],_}] ->
   48: 	    %% Fake release, no applications
   49: 	    {skip, "Need a real release running to create other releases"};
   50: 	_ ->
   51: 	    rm_rf(filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),priv_dir])),
   52: 	    Config
   53:     end.
   54: 
   55: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   56:     %% This function is required since init_per_suite/1 exists.
   57:     ok.
   58: 
   59: init_per_testcase(Case,Config) ->
   60:     PrivDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),priv_dir,Case]),
   61:     CreateDir = filename:join([PrivDir,create]),
   62:     InstallDir = filename:join([PrivDir,install]),
   63:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(CreateDir,"*")),
   64:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(InstallDir,"*")),
   65:     Config1 = lists:keyreplace(priv_dir,1,Config,{priv_dir,PrivDir}),
   66:     [{create_dir,CreateDir},{install_dir,InstallDir}|Config1].
   67: 
   68: end_per_testcase(_Case,Config) ->
   69:     Nodes = nodes(),
   70:     [test_server:stop_node(Node) || Node <- Nodes],
   71:     case proplists:get_value(tc_status,Config) of
   72: 	ok ->
   73: 	    %% Note that priv_dir here is per test case!
   74: 	    rm_rf(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config));
   75: 	_fail ->
   76: 	    %% Test case data can be found under DataDir/priv_dir/Case
   77: 	    ok
   78:     end,
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: all() ->
   82:     [minor,major,ancient_major].
   83: 
   84: %% If this is major release X, then this test performs an upgrade from
   85: %% major release X-1 to the current release.
   86: major(Config) ->
   87:     put(verbose, true),
   88:     p("major -> get current major release"),
   89:     Current = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
   90:     PreviousMajor = previous_major(Current),
   91:     upgrade_test(PreviousMajor,Current,Config).
   92: 
   93: %% If this is major release X, then this test performs an upgrade from
   94: %% major release X-2 to the current release.
   95: ancient_major(Config) ->
   96:     put(verbose, true),
   97:     p("ancient_major -> get current major release"),
   98:     Current = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
   99:     PreviousPreviousMajor = previous_major(previous_major(Current)),
  100:     upgrade_test(PreviousPreviousMajor,Current,Config).
  101: 
  102: %% If this is a patched version of major release X, then this test
  103: %% performs an upgrade from major release X to the current release.
  104: minor(Config) ->
  105:     put(verbose, true),
  106:     p("minor -> get current major release"),
  107:     CurrentMajor = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
  108:     Current = CurrentMajor++"_patched",
  109:     upgrade_test(CurrentMajor,Current,Config).
  110: 
  111: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  112: upgrade_test(FromVsn,ToVsn,Config) ->
  113:     p("upgrade_test -> entry with"
  114:       "~n      FromVsn: ~p"
  115:       "~n      ToVsn:   ~p"
  116:       "~n      Config:  ~p", [FromVsn, ToVsn, Config]),
  117:     OldRel =
  118: 	case test_server:is_release_available(FromVsn) of
  119: 	    true ->
  120: 		{release,FromVsn};
  121: 	    false ->
  122: 		case ct:get_config({otp_releases,list_to_atom(FromVsn)}) of
  123: 		    undefined ->
  124: 			false;
  125: 		    Prog0 ->
  126: 			case os:find_executable(Prog0) of
  127: 			    false ->
  128: 				false;
  129: 			    Prog ->
  130: 				{prog,Prog}
  131: 			end
  132: 		end
  133: 	end,
  134:     p("upgrade_test -> old release: "
  135:       "~n      ~p", [OldRel]),
  136:     case OldRel of
  137: 	false ->
  138: 	    %% Note that priv_dir here is per test case!
  139: 	    rm_rf(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)),
  140: 	    {skip, "no previous release available"};
  141: 	_ ->
  142: 	    upgrade_test1(FromVsn,ToVsn,[{old_rel,OldRel}|Config])
  143:     end.
  144: 
  145: upgrade_test1(FromVsn,ToVsn,Config) ->
  146:     p("upgrade_test1 -> get create-dir"),
  147:     CreateDir = proplists:get_value(create_dir,Config),
  148:     p("upgrade_test1 -> get install-dir"),
  149:     InstallDir = proplists:get_value(install_dir,Config),
  150:     FromRelName = "otp-"++FromVsn,
  151:     ToRelName = "otp-"++ToVsn,
  152: 
  153:     {FromRel,FromApps} = target_system(FromRelName, FromVsn,
  154: 				       CreateDir, InstallDir,Config),
  155:     p("upgrade_test1 -> target system:"
  156:       "~n      FromRel:  ~p"
  157:       "~n      FromApps: ~p", [FromRel, FromApps]),
  158:     {ToRel,ToApps} = upgrade_system(FromVsn, FromRel, ToRelName, ToVsn,
  159: 				    CreateDir, InstallDir),
  160:     p("upgrade_test1 -> upgrade system:"
  161:       "~n      ToRel:  ~p"
  162:       "~n      ToApps: ~p", [ToRel, ToApps]),
  163:     do_upgrade(FromVsn, FromApps, ToRel, ToApps, InstallDir).
  164: 
  165: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  166: %%% This is similar to sasl/examples/src/target_system.erl, but with
  167: %%% the following adjustments:
  168: %%% - add a log directory
  169: %%% - use an own 'start' script
  170: %%% - chmod 'start' and 'start_erl'
  171: target_system(RelName0,RelVsn,CreateDir,InstallDir,Config) ->
  172:     p("target_system -> start worker node"),
  173:     {ok,Node} = test_server:start_node(list_to_atom(RelName0),peer,
  174: 				       [{erl,[proplists:get_value(old_rel,Config)]}]),
  175: 
  176:     p("target_system -> create relfile"),
  177:     {RelName,Apps,ErtsVsn} = create_relfile(Node,CreateDir,RelName0,RelVsn),
  178:  
  179:     %% Create .script and .boot
  180:     p("target_system -> create .script and .boot"),
  181:     ok = rpc:call(Node,systools,make_script,[RelName]),
  182:     
  183:     %% Create base tar file - i.e. erts and all apps
  184:     p("target_system -> create base tar file"),
  185:     ok = rpc:call(Node,systools,make_tar,
  186: 		  [RelName,[{erts,rpc:call(Node,code,root_dir,[])}]]),
  187:     
  188:     %% Unpack the tar to complete the installation
  189:     p("target_system -> unpack to complete installation"),
  190:     erl_tar:extract(RelName ++ ".tar.gz", [{cwd, InstallDir}, compressed]),
  191:     
  192:     %% Add bin and log dirs
  193:     p("target_system -> add bin and log dirs"),
  194:     BinDir = filename:join([InstallDir, "bin"]),
  195:     file:make_dir(BinDir),
  196:     file:make_dir(filename:join(InstallDir,"log")),
  197: 
  198:     %% Delete start scripts - they will be added later
  199:     p("target_system -> delete start scripts"),
  200:     ErtsBinDir = filename:join([InstallDir, "erts-" ++ ErtsVsn, "bin"]),
  201:     file:delete(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "erl"])),
  202:     file:delete(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "start"])),
  203:     file:delete(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "start_erl"])),
  204:     
  205:     %% Copy .boot to bin/start.boot
  206:     p("target_system -> copy .boot and bin/start.boot"),
  207:     copy_file(RelName++".boot",filename:join([BinDir, "start.boot"])),
  208:     
  209:     %% Copy scripts from erts-xxx/bin to bin
  210:     p("target_system -> copy scripts from erts-xxx/bin to bin"),
  211:     copy_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "epmd"]), 
  212:               filename:join([BinDir, "epmd"]), [preserve]),
  213:     copy_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "run_erl"]), 
  214:               filename:join([BinDir, "run_erl"]), [preserve]),
  215:     copy_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "to_erl"]), 
  216:               filename:join([BinDir, "to_erl"]), [preserve]),
  217:     
  218:     %% create start_erl.data and sys.config
  219:     p("target_system -> create start_erl.data and sys.config"),
  220:     StartErlData = filename:join([InstallDir, "releases", "start_erl.data"]),
  221:     write_file(StartErlData, io_lib:fwrite("~s ~s~n", [ErtsVsn, RelVsn])),
  222:     SysConfig = filename:join([InstallDir, "releases", RelVsn, "sys.config"]),
  223:     write_file(SysConfig, "[]."),
  224:     
  225:     %% Insert 'start' script from data_dir - modified to add sname and heart
  226:     p("target_system -> insert 'start' script from data-dir"),
  227:     copy_file(filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),"start.src"),
  228: 	      filename:join(ErtsBinDir,"start.src")),
  229:     ok = file:change_mode(filename:join(ErtsBinDir,"start.src"),8#0755),
  230: 
  231:     %% Make start_erl executable
  232:     %% (this has been fixed in OTP 17 - is is now installed with
  233:     %% $INSTALL_SCRIPT instead of $INSTALL_DATA and should therefore
  234:     %% be executable from the start)
  235:     p("target_system -> make start_erl executable"),
  236:     ok = file:change_mode(filename:join(ErtsBinDir,"start_erl.src"),8#0755),
  237: 
  238:     %% Substitute variables in erl.src, start.src and start_erl.src
  239:     %% (.src found in erts-xxx/bin - result stored in bin)
  240:     p("target_system -> substitute variables"),
  241:     subst_src_scripts(["erl", "start", "start_erl"], ErtsBinDir, BinDir, 
  242:                       [{"FINAL_ROOTDIR", InstallDir}, {"EMU", "beam"}],
  243:                       [preserve]),
  244: 
  245:     %% Create RELEASES
  246:     p("target_system -> create releases"),
  247:     RelFile = filename:join([InstallDir, "releases", 
  248: 			     filename:basename(RelName) ++ ".rel"]),
  249:     release_handler:create_RELEASES(InstallDir, RelFile),
  250: 
  251:     p("target_system -> stop worker node"),
  252:     true = test_server:stop_node(Node),
  253: 
  254:     p("target_system -> done"),
  255:     {RelName,Apps}.
  256: 
  257: 
  258: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  259: %%% Create a release containing the current (the test node) OTP
  260: %%% release, including relup to allow upgrade from an earlier OTP
  261: %%% release.
  262: upgrade_system(FromVsn, FromRel, ToRelName0, ToVsn,
  263: 	       CreateDir, InstallDir) ->
  264: 
  265:     p("upgrade_system -> create relfile"),
  266:     {RelName,Apps,_} = create_relfile(node(),CreateDir,ToRelName0,ToVsn),
  267:     FromPath = filename:join([InstallDir,lib,"*",ebin]),
  268: 
  269:     p("upgrade_system -> make script"),
  270:     ok = systools:make_script(RelName),
  271:     p("upgrade_system -> make relup"),
  272:     ok = systools:make_relup(RelName,[FromRel],[FromRel],
  273: 			     [{path,[FromPath]},
  274: 			      {outdir,CreateDir}]),
  275: 
  276:     case {FromVsn,ToVsn} of
  277:         {"20"++_,"21"++_} ->
  278:             p("upgrade_system -> try fix relup (with regards to inets ftp)"),
  279:             fix_relup_inets_ftp(filename:dirname(RelName));
  280:         _ -> ok
  281:     end,
  282: 
  283:     p("upgrade_system -> write system conf file"),
  284:     SysConfig = filename:join([CreateDir, "sys.config"]),
  285:     write_file(SysConfig, "[]."),
  286: 
  287:     p("upgrade_system -> make tar"),
  288:     ok = systools:make_tar(RelName,[{erts,code:root_dir()}]),
  289: 
  290:     p("upgrade_system -> done"),
  291:     {RelName,Apps}.
  292: 
  293: %% In OTP-21, ftp and tftp were split out from inets and formed two
  294: %% new separate applications. When creating the relup, systools
  295: %% automatically adds new applications first, before upgrading
  296: %% existing applications. Since ftp and tftp have processes with the
  297: %% same name as in the old version of inets, the upgrade failed with
  298: %% trying to start the new applications (already exist).
  299: %%
  300: %% To go around this problem, this function adds an instruction to
  301: %% stop inets before the new applications are started. This is a very
  302: %% specific adjustment, and it will be needed for any upgrade which
  303: %% involves conversion from inets to ftp/tftp.
  304: fix_relup_inets_ftp(Dir) ->
  305:     Filename = filename:join(Dir,"relup"),
  306:     {ok,[{ToVsn,Up,Down}]} = file:consult(Filename),
  307:     [{FromVsn,UpDescr,UpInstr}] = Up,
  308:     [{FromVsn,DownDescr,DownInstr}] = Down,
  309: 
  310:     Fun = fun(point_of_no_return) -> false;
  311:              (_) -> true
  312:           end,
  313:     {UpBefore,[point_of_no_return|UpAfter]} = lists:splitwith(Fun,UpInstr),
  314:     {DownBefore,[point_of_no_return|DownAfter]} = lists:splitwith(Fun,DownInstr),
  315:     NewRelup =
  316:         {ToVsn,
  317:          [{FromVsn,UpDescr,UpBefore++[point_of_no_return,
  318:                                       {apply,{application,stop,[inets]}} |
  319:                                       UpAfter]}],
  320:          [{FromVsn,DownDescr,DownBefore++[point_of_no_return,
  321:                                           {apply,{application,stop,[inets]}} |
  322:                                           DownAfter]}]},
  323:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(Filename, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
  324:     io:format(Fd, "%% ~s~n~tp.~n", [epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),NewRelup]),
  325:     ok = file:close(Fd).
  326: 
  327: 
  328: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  329: %%% Start a new node running the release from target_system/5
  330: %%% above. Then upgrade to the system from upgrade_system/5.
  331: do_upgrade(FromVsn,FromApps,ToRel,ToApps,InstallDir) ->
  332: 
  333:     p("do_upgrade -> entry with"
  334:       "~n      FromVsn:    ~p"
  335:       "~n      FromApps:   ~p"
  336:       "~n      ToRel:      ~p"
  337:       "~n      ToApps:     ~p"
  338:       "~n      InstallDir: ~p",
  339:       [FromVsn, FromApps, ToRel, ToApps, InstallDir]),
  340: 
  341:     Start = filename:join([InstallDir,bin,start]),
  342:     p("do_upgrade -> start (worker from-) node"),
  343:     {ok,Node} = start_node(Start,permanent,FromVsn,FromApps),
  344: 
  345:     p("do_upgrade -> verify (from-) release (permanent)"),
  346:     [{"OTP upgrade test",FromVsn,_,permanent}] =
  347: 	rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
  348:     ToRelName = filename:basename(ToRel),
  349:     p("do_upgrade -> copy (to-) release"),
  350:     copy_file(ToRel++".tar.gz",
  351: 	      filename:join([InstallDir,releases,ToRelName++".tar.gz"])),
  352:     p("do_upgrade -> unpack (to-) release"),
  353:     {ok,ToVsn} = rpc:call(Node,release_handler,unpack_release,[ToRelName]),
  354:     p("do_upgrade -> verify release(s) (unpacked,permanent)"),
  355:     [{"OTP upgrade test",ToVsn,_,unpacked},
  356:      {"OTP upgrade test",FromVsn,_,permanent}] =
  357: 	rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
  358:     p("do_upgrade -> install (to-) release"),
  359:     case rpc:call(Node,release_handler,install_release,[ToVsn]) of
  360: 	{ok,FromVsn,_} ->
  361: 	    ok;
  362: 	{continue_after_restart,FromVsn,_} ->
  363: 	    wait_node_up(current,ToVsn,ToApps)
  364:     end,
  365:     p("do_upgrade -> verify release(s) (current,permanent)"),
  366:     [{"OTP upgrade test",ToVsn,_,current},
  367:      {"OTP upgrade test",FromVsn,_,permanent}] =
  368: 	rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
  369:     p("do_upgrade -> make (to-) permanent"),
  370:     ok = rpc:call(Node,release_handler,make_permanent,[ToVsn]),
  371:     p("do_upgrade -> verify release(s) (permanent,old)"),
  372:     [{"OTP upgrade test",ToVsn,_,permanent},
  373:      {"OTP upgrade test",FromVsn,_,old}] =
  374: 	rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
  375:     
  376:     p("do_upgrade -> stop (worker) node"),
  377:     erlang:monitor_node(Node,true),
  378:     _ = rpc:call(Node,init,stop,[]),
  379:     receive {nodedown,Node} -> ok end,
  380: 
  381:     p("do_upgrade -> done"),
  382:     ok.
  383: 
  384: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  385: %%% Library functions
  386: previous_major("17") ->
  387:     "r16b";
  388: previous_major(Rel) ->
  389:     integer_to_list(list_to_integer(Rel)-1).
  390: 
  391: create_relfile(Node,CreateDir,RelName0,RelVsn) ->
  392:     LibDir = rpc:call(Node,code,lib_dir,[]),
  393:     SplitLibDir = filename:split(LibDir),
  394:     Paths = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
  395:     Exclude = ?start_exclude ++ ?appup_exclude,
  396:     Apps = lists:flatmap(
  397: 	     fun(Path) ->
  398: 		     case lists:prefix(LibDir,Path) of
  399: 			 true ->
  400: 			     case filename:split(Path) -- SplitLibDir of
  401: 				 [AppVsn,"ebin"] ->
  402: 				     case string:lexemes(AppVsn,"-") of
  403: 					 [AppStr,Vsn] ->
  404: 					     App = list_to_atom(AppStr),
  405: 					     case lists:member(App,Exclude) of
  406: 						 true ->
  407: 						     [];
  408: 						 false ->
  409: 						     [{App,Vsn,restart_type(App)}]
  410: 					     end;
  411: 					 _ ->
  412: 					     []
  413: 				     end;
  414: 				 _ ->
  415: 				     []
  416: 			     end;
  417: 			 false ->
  418: 			     []
  419: 		     end
  420: 	     end,
  421: 	     Paths),
  422: 
  423:     ErtsVsn = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [version]),
  424:     
  425:     %% Create the .rel file
  426:     RelContent = {release, {"OTP upgrade test", RelVsn}, {erts, ErtsVsn}, Apps},
  427:     RelName = filename:join(CreateDir,RelName0),
  428:     RelFile = RelName++".rel",
  429:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(RelFile,[write,{encoding,utf8}]),
  430:     io:format(Fd,"~tp.~n",[RelContent]),
  431:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  432:     {RelName,Apps,ErtsVsn}.
  433: 
  434: restart_type(App) when App==kernel; App==stdlib; App==sasl ->
  435:     permanent;
  436: restart_type(_) ->
  437:     temporary.
  438: 
  439: copy_file(Src, Dest) ->
  440:     copy_file(Src, Dest, []).
  441: 
  442: copy_file(Src, Dest, Opts) ->
  443:     {ok,_} = file:copy(Src, Dest),
  444:     case lists:member(preserve, Opts) of
  445:         true ->
  446:             {ok, FileInfo} = file:read_file_info(Src),
  447:             file:write_file_info(Dest, FileInfo);
  448:         false ->
  449:             ok
  450:     end.
  451: 
  452: 
  453: write_file(FName, Conts) ->
  454:     Enc = file:native_name_encoding(),
  455:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(FName, [write]),
  456:     file:write(Fd, unicode:characters_to_binary(Conts,Enc,Enc)),
  457:     file:close(Fd).
  458: 
  459: 
  460: subst_src_scripts(Scripts, SrcDir, DestDir, Vars, Opts) -> 
  461:     lists:foreach(fun(Script) ->
  462:                           subst_src_script(Script, SrcDir, DestDir, 
  463:                                            Vars, Opts)
  464:                   end, Scripts).
  465: 
  466: subst_src_script(Script, SrcDir, DestDir, Vars, Opts) -> 
  467:     subst_file(filename:join([SrcDir, Script ++ ".src"]),
  468:                filename:join([DestDir, Script]),
  469:                Vars, Opts).
  470: 
  471: subst_file(Src, Dest, Vars, Opts) ->
  472:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
  473:     Conts = binary_to_list(Bin),
  474:     NConts = subst(Conts, Vars),
  475:     write_file(Dest, NConts),
  476:     case lists:member(preserve, Opts) of
  477:         true ->
  478:             {ok, FileInfo} = file:read_file_info(Src),
  479:             file:write_file_info(Dest, FileInfo);
  480:         false ->
  481:             ok
  482:     end.
  483: 
  484: %% subst(Str, Vars)
  485: %% Vars = [{Var, Val}]
  486: %% Var = Val = string()
  487: %% Substitute all occurrences of %Var% for Val in Str, using the list
  488: %% of variables in Vars.
  489: %%
  490: subst(Str, Vars) ->
  491:     subst(Str, Vars, []).
  492: 
  493: subst([$%, C| Rest], Vars, Result) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  494:     subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, []);
  495: subst([$%, C| Rest], Vars, Result) when $a =< C, C =< $z ->
  496:     subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, []);
  497: subst([$%, C| Rest], Vars, Result) when  C == $_ ->
  498:     subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, []);
  499: subst([C| Rest], Vars, Result) ->
  500:     subst(Rest, Vars, [C| Result]);
  501: subst([], _Vars, Result) ->
  502:     lists:reverse(Result).
  503: 
  504: subst_var([$%| Rest], Vars, Result, VarAcc) ->
  505:     Key = lists:reverse(VarAcc),
  506:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Vars) of
  507:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
  508:             subst(Rest, Vars, lists:reverse(Value, Result));
  509:         false ->
  510:             subst(Rest, Vars, [$%| VarAcc ++ [$%| Result]])
  511:     end;
  512: subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, VarAcc) ->
  513:     subst_var(Rest, Vars, Result, [C| VarAcc]);
  514: subst_var([], Vars, Result, VarAcc) ->
  515:     subst([], Vars, [VarAcc ++ [$%| Result]]).
  516: 
  517: 
  518: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  519: %%% 
  520: start_node(Start,ExpStatus,ExpVsn,ExpApps) ->
  521:     case open_port({spawn_executable, Start}, [{env,[{"ERL_AFLAGS",false}]}]) of
  522:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
  523:             unlink(Port),
  524:             erlang:port_close(Port),
  525: 	    wait_node_up(ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps);
  526:         Error ->
  527:             Error
  528:     end.
  529: 
  530: wait_node_up(ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps0) ->
  531:     ExpApps = [{A,V} || {A,V,_T} <- ExpApps0],
  532:     Node    = node_name(?upgr_sname),
  533:     wait_node_up(Node, ExpStatus, ExpVsn, lists:keysort(1,ExpApps), 60).
  534: 
  535: wait_node_up(Node, ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps, 0) ->
  536:     LogTxt =
  537:         try erpc:call(Node, code, root_dir, []) of
  538:             Root ->
  539:                 LogGlob = filename:join([Root,"log","erlang.*"]),
  540:                 {ok, Log} = case filelib:wildcard(LogGlob) of
  541:                                 [Logfile|_] ->
  542:                                     file:read_file(Logfile);
  543:                                 [] ->
  544:                                     {ok, "No log file found"}
  545:                             end,
  546:                 Log
  547:         catch C:E ->
  548:                 {"erpc:call",C,E}
  549:         end,
  550:     p("wait_node_up -> fail~n"
  551:       "Logs: ~n~ts~n", [LogTxt]),
  552:     ct:fail({app_check_failed,ExpVsn,ExpApps,
  553: 	     rpc:call(Node, release_handler, which_releases,     [ExpStatus]),
  554: 	     rpc:call(Node, application,     which_applications, [])});
  555: wait_node_up(Node, ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps, N) ->
  556:     timer:sleep(2000),
  557:     p("wait_node_up -> [~w] get release vsn and apps", [N]),
  558:     case {rpc:call(Node, release_handler, which_releases,     [ExpStatus]),
  559:           rpc:call(Node, application,     which_applications, [])} of
  560:         {[{_,ExpVsn,_,_}],Apps} when is_list(Apps) ->
  561:             p("wait_node_up -> [~w] expected release vsn - check apps", [N]),
  562:             case [{A,V} || {A,_,V} <- lists:keysort(1,Apps)] of
  563:                 ExpApps ->
  564:                     p("wait_node_up -> [~w] expected apps", [N]),
  565:                     {ok, Node};
  566:                 UnexpApps ->
  567:                     p("wait_node_up -> [~w] still wrong apps:~n"
  568:                       "Missing:~p~n"
  569:                       "Extra:  ~p~n"
  570:                       "All:    ~p~n"
  571:                       , [N, ExpApps -- UnexpApps, UnexpApps -- ExpApps, UnexpApps]),
  572:                     wait_node_up(Node, ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps, N-1)
  573:             end;
  574:         {[{_,Vsn,_,_}],_} ->
  575:             p("wait_node_up -> [~w] still wrong release vsn:"
  576:               "~n      ~p", [N, Vsn]),
  577:             wait_node_up(Node, ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps, N-1);
  578:         X ->
  579:             p("wait_node_up -> [~w] unexpected results:"
  580:               "~n      ~p", [N, X]),
  581:             wait_node_up(Node, ExpStatus, ExpVsn, ExpApps, N-1)
  582:     end.
  583: 
  584: node_name(Sname) ->
  585:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  586:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Sname) ++ "@" ++ Host).
  587: 
  588: rm_rf(Dir) ->
  589:     case file:read_file_info(Dir) of
  590: 	{ok, #file_info{type = directory}} ->
  591: 	    {ok, Content} = file:list_dir_all(Dir),
  592: 	    [rm_rf(filename:join(Dir,C)) || C <- Content],
  593: 	    ok=file:del_dir(Dir),
  594: 	    ok;
  595: 	{ok, #file_info{}} ->
  596: 	    ok=file:delete(Dir);
  597: 	_ ->
  598: 	    ok
  599:     end. 
  600: 
  601: 
  602: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  603: %%% 
  604: 
  605: p(F) ->
  606:     p(F, []).
  607: 
  608: p(F, A) ->
  609:     p(get(verbose), F, A).
  610: 
  611: p(true, F, A) ->
  612:     print(F, A);
  613: p(_, _, _) ->
  614:     ok.
  615: 
  616: print(F, A) ->
  617:     ct:pal(F ++ "~n", A).
  618:
